website_summaries.verdict: The New Balance 870 v5 yielded a lot of positive reviews from several runners, testers, and experts. A lot of them highly appreciate the support that the shoe provides. Most of the comments are also focused on the shoe’s ability to prevent overpronation because of the support it provides. There have been positive responses regarding the shoe’s lightweight construction, which helps runners conserve energy in the long run. Overall, there are minimal updates made to shoe such as its engineered knit upper and ground-contact EVA outsole, but when all of its standard components are combined, a highly responsive and comfortable stability shoe is created.
pros: A lot of the users admire how lightweight the New Balance 870 v5 is
The shoe has helped prevent overpronation of the foot by providing enough support, a few runners noted
Some of the testers have claimed that this stability running shoe is the most comfortable to run in
The upper of the shoe, which is made out of engineered knit, provides enough breathability, some testers and experts remarked
Several runners have praised the shoe’s ground-contact ethylene-vinyl acetate (EVA) outsole with rubber pods that provided zero slips when running
A lot of the wearers praise the shoe’s versatility
it can be worn for everyday wear and as a workout supplement
cons: One of the runners says that the 870 v5 caused some pain on the foot
A few testers have stated that the shoe did not have sufficient cushioning making the shoe too firm

customer_reviews.title: Like the shoes, love the price.
customer_reviews.text: I stopped purchasing running shoes over $80 a few years back. I'm an avid runner, not looking to break the land speed records or have needs to look like I own the latest swag. I had these before and glad they were still available. Now they're cheaper because it's a few years old. Still running just fine, the shoes fit just like the old one, and my knees are thankful that I finally bought replacement shoes. I run about 6:30-7:00/mile now. I have no clue what a professional runner would say about these shoes. The pros probably get custom made anyways. So these are perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeShopper

customer_reviews.title: Chewed Up In Less Than a Month
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes in mid-June and did not begin wearing them until July 1. By July 17 I noticed significant wear on the upper soles of both shoes. The picture I've uploaded was from July 28. The shoes are basically unsafe and unusable at this point and need to be replaced. I walk about 5 miles per day and only on the road so there is no reason they should wear so quickly. I'm not sure if I just received a subpar pair but I will most likely not purchase New Balance again. I hoping the seller refunds me in some way.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Ennico

customer_reviews.title: New Balance for life!
customer_reviews.text: I had been having foot pain for 6 months and I switched to these and after two days my foot has almost gone away. I use these for work and I walk back and forth a lot. These shoes are like walking on clouds.
customer_reviews.author: RobotNerd

customer_reviews.title: Crap falls apart
customer_reviews.text: Bought these end of may. About 1.5 months later, after the return window closed, the soles are already tearing off from light use. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tread seperation
customer_reviews.text: Love the fit of the shoe. Worn only to go walking 2-3 times a week. By week 5 the yellow tread pieces separated from the sole. Conveniently after the return policy had expired. So I can;t return them. Have worn NB for years and this is the first time I have had such an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in two months
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with the comfort and look when they first arrived. Felt great going for a few mile jog and have used them daily, mostly walking / running a few miles per day. After about 2 months, one piece of rubber started to fall off (see picture) and bottom rubber wore down FAST. Plus, some of the lining inside the shoe by the toes started to hang loose and fell off. I now need to purchase a new pair after just 2 months. Typically, I get a new pair every 6-8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent running shoe, great value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my husband who is an avid runner at 5+ miles/day. He had bought the same style in-store last year; we saved nearly $50 by purchasing at this price. They are excellent shoes, very comfortable. We sometimes worry that products sold at discounted rates may not be of the same quality as in the store, but these are flawless and clearly neither a return nor a second-rate item. If you're thinking about them - go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Lee

customer_reviews.title: Bottom fell apart for both shoes
customer_reviews.text: Decent shoes, but terrible build quality. I used them for less than a month and both shoes' bottoms started falling apart. They need to use better glue or something.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Sole started peaking away in less then 2 months of light use!
customer_reviews.text: I wear them on the weekends for walking shoes. One of them started peaking on the sole. If it would have happened within 30 days I could have returned it but I’m stuck with a defective shoe. Never had this issue with other New Balance, but I usually get the higher priced running shoes. Do not order these!!! I have only worn them 16 times:( and not even been running with them. I am only 160lbs.
customer_reviews.author: N. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, good arch support, light weight.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit nicely, ordered them in Wide, have terrific arch support, and are lightweight - perfect for the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Evry

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the gunmetal/pigment version of these shoes for quite some time (bought elsewhere for more than $100) and when I bought the current ones (black/white), was a bit hesitant by seeing some of the bad experiences people had in the recent past. Gave it a try anyway as it was less than half the price I paid earlier. Have been running ~6 miles every week for the past 3 months and these are holding up very well. Will definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ajay

customer_reviews.title: Great Comforable Shoe - but...
customer_reviews.text: I usually have good luck with New Balance Shoes- the comfort was great, purchased as a Shoe for treadmills, per site recommendation - but already the soul of the shoe is coming apart. Not very good quality at all. sadly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Stilfield

customer_reviews.title: Don't last
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are 6 weeks old. They are already completely worn down to the foam. Won't order again.
customer_reviews.author: jTasch

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, a little wider in the toe which I liked even though not a wide side. Delivered in just 3 days. Good support.
customer_reviews.author: Virgina John

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and stability
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable well-worth the price offers stability and support I'm considering buying a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Victor M.C.

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: My son said they are the most comfortable shoes he has worn. Has a nice memory foam sole
customer_reviews.author: Amy Timmerman

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe and sizing is consistent
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe just not enough support for my flat feet.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Hand Luke

customer_reviews.title: Narrower than 680s
customer_reviews.text: Very bright blue. Ran narrow. Have been wearing 680s and love the fit. These are much more narrow and seem to have less stability.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it for a week usage
customer_reviews.text: Shoes looked nice and fell okay. But after just 5 days they have begun to fall apart. Not quality I am used to with new balance.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn guinn

customer_reviews.title: One foot Hurts
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my plantar fasciitis but please go for brooks adrenaline gts 19/20 it you’re buying for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Faraz

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe and fit well. Use for walking and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McKinley

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe offers great support and is very comfortable. It fit a bit snug but not uncomfortable. Next time I will opt for 1/2 size larger or wide option. Otherwise, it has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Looks wise, the bottom is a bit chunky but I’ve used it for a few months at Orange Theory and they are perfect. I bought a pair of Nike Zoom at the same time which look better but prefer these for functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Len Lester

customer_reviews.title: New Balance 870 V5
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for the price. Would buy again, exact fit.
customer_reviews.author: john vernon

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for the money. Good cushioning, support and stability. Just a bit tighter in the toe box than previous pairs of NB
customer_reviews.author: Roc

customer_reviews.title: The Sole peels off
customer_reviews.text: a piece of the sole peels off the first day you wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia

customer_reviews.title: Good support. Moderate weight. Good fit.
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my feet. I have double wide feet and I don’t get any hot spots from them. Good support. Moderate weight. Good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Kelley

customer_reviews.title: super high quality
customer_reviews.text: design and materials of this shoe made an immediate difference to my feet, knees, back and hips. Super suuportive!
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe at a amazing price
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing shoes to ride a stationary bike. Great comfort and support. And as always Amazon got them to me in two days 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: As good as the 880 New Balance Model
customer_reviews.text: I had the New Balance 880 and I got this product. Good shoe. Hopefully it lasts as long as the 880.
customer_reviews.author: mpk

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I m training for a marathon and these fit well.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband and he loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Mary T

customer_reviews.title: Not holding up well after minimal use
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many pairs of New Balance for my husband and children over the years because they offer wide widths. However, this is the second pair of NB that came apart quickly. The first was my son’s shoes within a month. This pair was bought in August, but they have not been worn the equivalent of two weeks in that time. It is truly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, comfortable, poor construction
customer_reviews.text: After a couple weeks of normal wear, the gray pieces on the sole began to come unglued. No rain, snow or hard use were involved. Just a kid being a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Don't think, just buy
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular. Fit, feel, and weight are all amazing. If they last, then this might be a near-perfect shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Maybe the most comfy shoes I've purchased in the past few years... I may purchase another pair before they change the design
customer_reviews.author: Greg O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: It's been a month, refund not issued yet!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't fit. Returned a month ago and no refund yet. What's going on?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Little Support!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good-looking shoe, but the sole is not as sturdy as I had hoped. Good for walking around the house, but that’s about it!
customer_reviews.author: Goodboy61

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's 870 D Road Running Shoes
product_meta.description: A stаble running shoe no longer has to be a heavy running shoe. The shoe reigns at the lighter side of stability, with the synthetic and TPU upper offering a light, breathable, comfortаble fit, and the extended ABZORB® crash pad, the blown rubber forefoot and the REVlite® midsole—featuring an 8mm offset—bringing the stability and comfort when the rubber hits the road. Features: 8mm drop: due to variances created during the development and manufacturing processes, all references to 8mm drop are approximate, Blown rubber outsole, Breathable air mesh, No sew welded seams, Synthetic/Mesh upper. 279 gram.
feature_bullets: Light style that doesn't strain your run.
Slightly structured upper material and middle post for a stable ride
